title: LexBib project
segmentation: I would like to draw your attention on Lex Pip, which is a project we're preparing at Hildesheim.
We are just about to submit a proposal to German Funding Agency DFG.
So what I'm presenting is basically the content of our proposal.
I will briefly talk about our goals, the features, methods and workflow of our project.
The partners in the working plan.
If you wanted more detailed, please refer to our new Rolex Libyana Paper.
So we all know what we have now at the moment regarding the biographies of lexicography and dictionary research, also known as Metal Oxy lexicography.
Now there are many bibliography's, isolated from each other.
So what we usually do is to use Google Scholar or some kind of general search engine or metadata repository, where the entries are not complete or noisy.
And another problem is the language barrier, no, if we look for a keyboard in Spanish, we might find only papers written in Spanish and so on.

Another problem is that everybody uses their own keywords or subject headings and we want to overcome all this and unify these islands, complete and correct the metadata and provide a multilingual labeled domain ontology which may serve is excess structure.
To our bibliography.
We also want to create an online platform where we will publish all this content.
This will have the following features, advanced search and browsing functions accessed through our domain ontology.
Access through the citation network.
I will explain this now and author pages and of course links to the full text the full text.
We will not give away to the people, but we will provide the link to the place where the full text can be found.
So this is this is our workflow and working package one which is the collection and validation of meta data.
We get the meta data and the full text from our sources.
The meta data goes into Zotero.
And the full text is attached to the item there.
In some cases we might need to scan or OCR the full text, and if it's a collective volume, in many cases we have to split this PDF and provide the single article instead of the whole thing.
Working pects by two is the computational part.
We will use term extraction topic modeling and citation extraction for term extraction.
We have the tools we've developed by hide and others in Stuttgart.
We have it ready for English and German at the moment, but we also wanted to prepare for other languages.
The approach is the weirdness of the term candidate in relation to related know compared to general language corpora.
This is additional meta data we will publish.
Then together with the item and we also plan to map these term candidates to the nodes of our domain ontology topic modeling we use for a recommender system.
This is widely used approach.
Yeah, by the numeric values of the outcome of the topic modeling tool.
We recommend similar articles to the user.
Is citation extraction we do with the group IT tool presented yesterday by Muhammad and we validate these citation.
These citations with Crossref and open citations.
Then this additional metadata we get in an RDF document, together with the meta data from that era, which is translated by this RDF translator.
Also to RDF.
Working pic three is about the domain ontology.

Which is a controlled vocabulary of subject headings at the moment in existing resources, like a Library of Congress, Congress, subject headings, D&B oh Vicky data we have lexicography with at most one level of child elements.
So what we want to offer is a branch that starts there.
Yeah, and it's linked to this these resources.
We want to label the nodes of our domain Ontology multilingual E so that you may perform a search in Spanish, but find results also in other languages.
And therefore this domain ontology.
We're looking at existing resources, we're looking at vegans.
We're looking at Cordoba and Armada, which Spanish authors.
And then of course we want to we want to use the linked open data standards with, which means that we use existing element sets like Dublin Core or Bible Ontology and link to existing resources.
Working pick fear for is about publishing.
Before we have our online platform ready, we will publish our content on Sotero.
This is also.
This is already available with the data we have at the moment.
Then we will provide our data via Anna Sparkle endpoint and of course for the end user on our online platform.
Working Pic 5 is dissemination on community at your legs and elects conferences.
We will be present and collect feedback and the office will be.
The persons will be able to come to us and add some information to their personal profile page if they want.
An additional research question which is more general and which is interesting for DFK is to be able to make predictions for the for the application of similar workflows to bigger domains.
So we will track our manual effort and so that would be so that we will be able to make such predictions.

Our partners in the DFB project University till the time with which side is Pi believe Brandenburgers Academy divisions, often for computational work and dissemination and the ideas in Manheim for work on working Package 1 four and for the hosting of the research data and the online resource.

For preliminary work, we're getting financial support from University to design, and from Alexis and our partners in this further partners in this project are the Ural Xboard Emblic switches, the European master in lexicography, lexicography group in La Coruna in Spain.
They also have the Spanish language released other lexicography.
And we have a special agreement with Decoy to which is the publisher that has a lot of items relevant for us.

This year we actually collecting meta data from the Ural ex Dextra bibliography from Mobile X Meta, which is the popular graffiti made by the ideas we are parsing the Vagrant people Agra fee that has 33,000 items and also we will have access to two Spanish.
Bibliography is Cordoba and Ahumada for this year.
It is our goal to cover English for between.
2000 and 2018 so that when the DFK project starts, we will be able to directly kick off the computational working package tool.

And we are working on the 1st proposal of our domain ontology in case that we have K project starts in next year as we intend, we will collect publication meta data for all languages between 1971 and 2000.

Eighteen 71 is the year school starts school Star Manual of Lexicography was published and we will collect full text not only for English but also for German and Spanish and then proceed to other languages.
But of course, for the computational part.
We need to set up our pipeline for these other languages before we can.
We can extract the terms from there.
Yeah, and this is the mid term perspective that we want to include more languages and even older full texts.
So this is what I wanted to present for the time being.
And if you have any question.
